arm_group.description: Application of hydrocortisone 2.5% ointment or triamcinolone acetonide 0.1% ointment immediately to wet skin once a day and dry skin once a day.
Application of hydrocortisone 2.5% ointment or triamcinolone acetonide 0.1% ointment to dry skin twice a day.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy of two different corticosteroid
      ointment application regimens for the treatment of eczema (atopic dermatitis).

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing the Efficacy of Two Topical Steroid Application Regimens in Pediatric Patients With Atopic Dermatitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Meet the clinical criteria for the diagnosis of atopic dermatitis

          -  Have disease over at least 5% of their total body surface area.

          -  Less than 18 years of age.

          -  Families able to comprehend written instructions in English and able to complete
             questionnaires with assistance if needed.

          -  Parents/guardians able to understand and willing to sign a parental permission form.

          -  Children between the ages of 7-17 years willing to sign an age-appropriate assent
             form.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who are allergic or intolerant of the topical medications employed in this
             study.

          -  Lack of follow-up after initial visit or regimen noncompliance.

          -  Patients who do not have access to a bathtub.

intervention.description: Corticosteroid ointment applied to wet skin once a day and dry skin once a day.
Corticosteroid ointment applied to dry skin twice a day.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Investigator-Blinded Study Comparing the Efficacy of Two Topical Steroid Application Regimens in Pediatric Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
